guide.title: Gentoo Developer Relations
guide.subtitle: Main Page
guide.abstract: The Gentoo Developer Relations Project is an effort to recruit, train, and maintain developers for the various Gentoo projects.

body.p: Gentoo Developer Relations is a project in Gentoo which aims to be a point of contact for prospective developers, as well as a point of contact for current developers. For prospective developers, we use the mailing lists, the forums and the Gentoo bug tracker to watch for, and invite, prospective developers.

The stated goal for Gentoo Developer Relations is to act as a meeting point for Gentoo developers and advanced users both. As such, Gentoo Developer Relations is concerned with both intra-developer relations as well as forming relations with advanced users and prospective developers.

The current active subprojects in Hardened Gentoo are:
Project: Description:
Intra-Developer Relations Here, we maintain a constantly updated roster of developers, and their areas of development. Additionally, we maintain a record of developers' GPG public keys to provide a single area for developer lookup.
Recruitment and Training Currently, we have a process on the Gentoo bug tracker which tracks a new developer's progress from initial contact through training and final sign up. As part of a new developer's training, they must fulfill several requirements, culminating in a quiz/questionnaire. Every new developer is assigned to a mentor on the Gentoo development team.

The current planned subprojects in Gentoo Developer Relations are:
Project: Description:
Developer Conflict Resolution Grant Goodyear recently proposed a GLEP (Gentoo Linux Enhancement Proposal) calling for an Ombudsman to aid in developer conflict resolution. We would like to implement this plan in the near future.
Recruitment Policy One of the biggest questions in the user community is of how to become a Gentoo Developer. We will attempt to outline our requirements for a prospective developer as well as provide an interface for prospective developers to contact. Currently, interested parties can contact recruiters (at) gentoo (dot) org.
User Relations The goal of this subproject is to interface with the user community, to seek out motivated and skilled individuals for prospective hiring. Essentially, the concerns of the community with respect to developer relations will be listened to, and where possible, addressed.

Each person working on Gentoo Developer Relations is listed here, full time indicates that their main Gentoo position is on this project, part time indicates that their main position lies in another area but they do additional work with Gentoo Developer Relations.
